choices.B: The session was initiated from an authenticated user.
choices.C: The session is being inspected using flow inspection.
choices.A: The TCP session has been successfully established.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: AB
my answer is AB.
"proto_state=01" confirms that the TCP session is established (answer A)
"user=User1" authed confirms that the session is from an authenticated user. (answer B)

Selected Answer: D
my answer is D.
protocol options in FortiGate let administrators specify the mapping between Layer 4 port numbers and upper-layer protocols (e.g., HTTP, SMTP, FTP). 
this configuration ensures that the FortiGate accurately identifies and processes traffic based on the port-protocol associations. 
the other options do not correctly describe the functionality of protocol options.

choices.D: Protocol options allow administrators to configure which Layer 4 port numbers map to upper-layer protocols, such HTTP, SMTP, FTP, and so on.
choices.B: Protocol options give administrators a streamlined method to instruct FortiGate to block all sessions corresponding to disabled protocols.
choices.A: Protocol options allow administrators to configure a maximum number of sessions for each configured protocol.
choices.C: Protocol options allow administrators to configure the Any setting for all enabled protocols, which provides the most efficient use of system resources.

questions.question_text: Which statement about protocol options is true?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: CDE
C. OSPF interface network types match. OSPF uses network types to determine how to exchange routing information (e.g., broadcast, point-to-point). Mismatched network types will prevent adjacency formation.
D. Authentication settings match. If authentication is configured on one device, it must be configured on the peer with matching credentials for adjacency to be established.
E. OSPF router IDs are unique. Each router in an OSPF domain must have a unique Router ID. Duplicate IDs will cause confusion and prevent proper routing.

Selected Answer: CDE
Network type and authentication must match and Router IDs cannot be duplicated.

questions.question_text: Which three conditions are required for two FortiGate devices to form an OSPF adjacency? (Choose three.)

choices.B: OSPF interface priority settings are unique.

choices.C: The session would remain in the session table, and its traffic would egress from port2.
choices.B: The session would remain in the session table, but its traffic would now egress from both port1 and port2.
choices.A: The session would be deleted, and the client would need to start a new session.
choices.D: The session would remain in the session table, and its traffic would egress from port1.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: A
Page 95 of Study Guide - the command snat-route-change enable will force re-evaluation of the route, regardless of wether or not the route is in the FIB or not. If the SNAT IP changes, the session is flushed and client needs to initiate new connection.
